description: Translate only rows where nat_non, anth_veg, anth_non or nfl is not empty. All values represent an NFL translation. Note that none of these rows have species_1 info so every polygon is either LYR or NFL.

translation_rules: padConcat({inventory_id, src_filename, map_sheet_id, orig_stand_id, ogc_fid}, {4,15,10,10,7}, {'x','x','x','x','x'}, '-', TRUE, TRUE)
description: Concatenates five attributes to create CAS_ID
Soil moisture applies to all vegetated land cover types. Maps source value to SOIL_MOIST_REG using lists of values

Concatenate stand structure letter and structure percent value. Check value is in the possible list of values, if not return NOT_APPLICABLE. Then map to correct value. Value T appears in AB07 understory, it is always combined with an overstory value of M so we assign 100. AB16 has over 200 rows with an empty string assigned, we don`t know what these are so unknown is assigned.

translation_rules: countOfNotNull({species_1_layer1}, {species_1_layer2}, {nfl_layer, anth_veg_layer, anth_non_layer, nat_non_layer}, {unfl_layer, uanth_veg_layer, uanth_non_layer, unat_non_layer}, layer, FALSE)
description: Count layers up to max_layer_number which is set by the createMappingsView() function in the workflow. NFL rows will be reported below any LYR rows.
Layer rank is assigned as 1 for overstory layer (e.g. nat_non), and 2 for understory layer (e.g. unat_non).
NFL crown closure reported for shrub layers only as the percentage of polygon covered by shrub.
NFL crown closure reported for shrub layers only as the percentage of polygon covered by shrub.
Height descriptors of 1 m to 6 m will only apply to shrub cover. If nfl is shrub, height value is < 6 and is the height of the shrub layer. Note that AB08 appears to break the 6m rule.
Height descriptors of 1 m to 6 m will only apply to shrub cover. If nfl is shrub, height value is < 6 and is the height of the shrub layer. Note that AB08 appears to break the 6m rule.
Maps source value to NAT_NON_VEG using list of values

validation_rules: notNull({anth_veg, anth_non}, TRUE|NOT_APPLICABLE);notEmpty({anth_veg, anth_non}, TRUE|NOT_APPLICABLE);hasCountOfNotNull({anth_veg, anth_non}, 1, TRUE|UNKNOWN_VALUE);matchListTwice(anth_veg, anth_non, {'CIP','CIW','CA','CP','CPR','IG','IH','II','SR','CIU'}, {'ASC','ASR','AIG','AIH','AIE','AIF','AIM','AII','IW','PR','IP','P','A','AIU','AIW'})
description: Maps source value to NON_FOR_ANTH using list of values. Validation functions check that both values are not null or empty, and exactly one input has a value, and that the value is in anth_veg or anth_non. Note the source value CPR indicates rough pasture and is translated to CULTIVATED. This is always accompanied by SO or SC with associated shrub extent and height. The shrub component gets translated as TALL_SHRUB or LOW_SHRUB in the same row as CULTIVATED to indicate they are paired and occur in the same layer. Note there are a small number of other rows that have two NFL values per row. With the current workflow we can either return one NFL per row, or we have to leave them all on the same row. We can't do both. So there will be some NFL rows that contain multiple values, in addition to the SHRUBxCULTIVATED rows metioned above. Currently this only effects <20 rows across all AB inventories.

Converts SO and SC to LOW_SHRUB if height is less than 2m. TALL_SHRUB if height is 2m or more. Maps HF to FORBS, HG to graminoids, and BR to BRYOID. Set ignoreCase to true in matchList and convert to uppercase in custom function to catch some lowercase codes in AB16.
